node.text: All the benefits of growth and technological change could only benefit those at the top — unless American workers have a voice.

node.text: Can I let you in on a secret? Billionaire philanthropy isn’t charity. It’s PR to cover up exploitative business practices and shield their wealth.

node.text: Ever notice how nobody asks “how are you going to pay for it” when we give massive government subsidies to Big Pharma, Big Oil, Big Tech, and defense contractors? We have socialism for the super-rich, merciless capitalism for the rest.

node.title: The Real Socialism in America is Not What You Think

node.text:
The U.S. welcomed nearly 130,000 Vietnamese refugees in April, 1975 following the Vietnam War. Now, following our disastrous 20 year war in Afghanistan, we have a moral obligation to welcome as many Afghan refugees as possible.

Call your reps: (202) 224-3121

Call script and other numbers to call at the linktree in my bio.

node.text: The media’s obsession with “balanced coverage” is nonsense. There is no middle ground between democracy and fascism.

node.title: The Media Bias Nobody is Talking About

node.text:
Millennials own less than 5% of all US wealth. In 1989, when baby boomers were the same age, they controlled 21% of the nation's wealth.

Young people are not lazy. The economy is rigged against them.

node.title: How the System is Failing Young People

node.text: Why aren’t Biden and the Dems doing everything in their power to protect voting rights? Is it just Manchin and Sinema? Or does the reason go deeper: because the moneyed interests who bankroll Democratic candidates are terrified of democracy?

node.title: The Oligarchy is Terrified of Democracy

node.text:
In 1916, Sears launched a program to share stock with its workers. By the 1950s, Sears workers had accumulated enough stock that they owned a quarter of the company. 

Who else thinks we should bring back profit-sharing?

node.text:
Frito-Lay workers are on strike in Kansas. Coal miners are on strike in Alabama. Rideshare drivers are on strike across the country.

Make no mistake: Workers are taking their power back.

node.title: Imagine a World Where Workers Have Power

node.text:
The next time someone claims billionaires rocketing off to space is a sign of societal progress and heroism, remind them that there are basically 4 ways to accumulate a billion dollars in America: 1) Profiting from a monopoly; 2) Insider trading; 3) Political payoffs; 4) Inheritance

None of these has anything to do with being successful in the supposed free market.

node.text: There are a lot of things to worry about right now, like climate change, voting rights, and worker exploitation. Here’s why inflation isn’t one of them, despite what conservatives and corporations would like you to believe.

node.title: Don’t Buy Into the Inflation Scare

node.text:
Since 1969, Democratic presidents have appointed 4 Supreme Court justices, while Republicans have appointed 16 (5 of them by presidents who lost the popular vote). McConnell refused to even hold a hearing on Obama's nominee.

Expanding the Supreme Court is not radical. It's essential. Thank you to @MondaireJones for setting the record straight and co-sponsoring legislation to make it happen.

node.title: Why Expanding the Supreme Court is Not Radical

node.text: All the benefits of growth and technological change could only benefit those at the top — unless American workers have a voice.

node.text: Staggering hypocrisy.

node.text: Do you want to defend reproductive freedom? Fight the climate crisis? Protect voting rights? Expand the Supreme Court? First, abolish the filibuster.

clips_music_attribution_info.song_name: The Magic Bomb (Questions I Get Asked)
clips_music_attribution_info.should_mute_audio_reason: Instagram music isn't available in your region.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich worst Texas has closed 750 polling places since 2013. Now the state just passed the voter suppression law in the country. Mail ballot drop boxes banned. Partisan poll watchers empowered. Voters of color suppressed. When are we going to wake up and pass federal voting legislation?'.

node.text: You know what’s more radical than abolishing the filibuster? Watching voting rights and the right to choose get eviscerated — and doing absolutely nothing to stop it.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich worst Texas has closed 750 polling places since 2013. Now the state just passed the voter suppression law in the country. Mail ballot drop boxes banned. Partisan poll watchers empowered. Voters of color suppressed. When are we going to wake up and pass federal voting legislation?'.
Photo by Robert Reich on September 03, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich It's reproductive freedom and voting rights or the filibuster. Dems, choose wisely.'.

Photo shared by Robert Reich on September 03, 2021 tagging @aoc. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Alexandria Ocasio- Ocasio-Cortez rtez @AOC Republicans promised to overturn Roe V Wade, and they have. Democrats can either abolish the filibuster and expand the court, or do nothing as millions of peoples' bodies, rights, and lives are sacrificed for far-right minority rule. This shouldn't be a difficult decision.'.

buttons.text: Visit the COVID-19 Information Center for vaccine resources.

node.text: So vaccine mandates are an infringement of personal freedom, but abortion bans aren't?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 02, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich … Today seems like a good day to remind you that half of the conservative Supreme Court majority was appointed by a president who lost the popular vote and instigated an attempted coup against the United States government. Expand the Court.'.

node.text: Congress has already changed the size of the Supreme Court seven times before. This is not radical. It’s essential. Expand the court.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 02, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich … Today seems like a good day to remind you that half of the conservative Supreme Court majority was appointed by a president who lost the popular vote and instigated an attempted coup against the United States government. Expand the Court.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 02, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Can we finally stop pretending it's radical to expand the Supreme Court? What's radical is enabling Supreme Court justices appointed by presidents who lost the popular vote to take away voting rights and reproductive rights from millions of Americans.'.

Photo by Robert Reich on September 01, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich News flash: If you ban mask mandates, outlaw abortions, dictate what educators can teach in schools, and stop people from voting, you're not the party of "limited government."'.

node.text: More like the party of social control.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 01, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Texas is empowering its citizens to: -Carry guns without a license -Sue service providers for helping people access Ûo -Challenge voter registrations to keep people from voting -Stop teachers from educating about racism or protecting students from COVID Connect the dots.'.

node.text: It’s all connected.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on September 01, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich Texas is empowering its citizens to: -Carry guns without a license -Sue service providers for helping people access Ûo -Challenge voter registrations to keep people from voting -Stop teachers from educating about racism or protecting students from COVID Connect the dots.'.

Photo shared by Robert Reich on September 01, 2021 tagging @naacp_ldf. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Sherrilyn Ifill @Sifill_LDF It's critical to understand the TX law b/c it is part of a desperate effort to do by harassment, intimidation, & menacing what could not be accomplished by regular channels of democratic engagement. It is of a piece w/recent voter suppression bills and anti-truth school bo mobs.'.
Photo by Robert Reich on August 31, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich How come "how are you going to pay for it" is never asked about endless war?'.

node.text: I never want to hear the phrase “how will you pay for it” when we just blew $2 trillion on a war that, like all wars, delivered only death and despair.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on August 31, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich How come "how are you going to pay for it" is never asked about endless war?'.

Photo by Robert Reich on August 31, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich The U.S. spent over $2 trillion on the Afghanistan war. U.S. billionaires added $1.8 trillion to their wealth during the pandemic alone. Don't tell me we can't afford universal health care or tuition-free college.'.

node.text: Can I let you in on a secret? Billionaire philanthropy isn’t charity. It’s PR to cover up exploitative business practices and shield their wealth.

node.text: Solidarity with the 1,000+ Nabisco workers who are fed up with the company's exploitation and striking for a fair contract. Don't cross the picket line.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Robert Reich on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Robert Reich @RBReich I fear we're about to discover what happens when a horrendous hurricane rams into an area with low vaccination rates, high COVID, and already-full hospitals. Sadly, these are not unrelated.'.

node.text: Hopes and prayers for the people of New Orleans now suffering the triple-whammy of COVID, Hurricane Ida, and shortages of hospital beds. But isn’t it about time America stopped relying on hopes and prayers to prevent the foreseeable and preventable?
